approach: Create a new session.rs module in specks-core that defines Session struct matching Spec S01 schema and SessionStatus enum with five variants (pending, in_progress, completed, failed, needs_reconcile). Implement load_session and save_session functions for JSON file I/O. Use serde for serialization with the existing project patterns. For timestamps, add a simple ISO 8601 timestamp generation utility using std::time::SystemTime (avoiding new dependencies). Export the new module from lib.rs.

implementation_steps.description: Create session.rs with SessionStatus enum (pending, in_progress, completed, failed, needs_reconcile) with Serialize, Deserialize, Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq derives and Display impl

Create Session struct with all fields from Spec S01: schema_version, speck_path, speck_slug, branch_name, base_branch, worktree_path, created_at, status, current_step, total_steps, beads_root. Add serde derives.
Implement now_iso8601() helper function to generate UTC timestamps in ISO 8601 format
Implement load_session(worktree_path: &Path) that reads and deserializes session.json
Implement save_session(session: &Session) that serializes to JSON and writes
Add unit tests for serialization roundtrip and status transitions

test_plan: Run `cargo build -p specks-core` to verify compilation with no warnings. Run `cargo nextest run -p specks-core session` to verify all session-related tests pass.
risks: ISO 8601 timestamp generation without chrono requires careful implementation
PathBuf serialization with serde needs verification
Session file path convention must be consistent with Step 2 worktree module
